definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Think about what are people willing to pay for, says Ms. Dunningham.
sentences.chinese: “想想人们愿意出钱做的工作，”坎宁安说。“

sentences.english: I afforded your trip but you rendered my son so much trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我出钱，还让我儿子受了这么多的窝囊气。

sentences.english: He also decided to pay the insignificant fare by himself.
sentences.chinese: 并且他决定自己出钱付那微不足道的船费。

sentences.english: Person of Wang Jiaao whole village goes money to give thing, bring back to life A Xia.
sentences.chinese: 王家凹全村人出钱出物，救活了阿霞。

sentences.english: Other gamblers beat him black and blue since he lost but couldn't pay.
sentences.chinese: 他赌输了，又付不出钱，其它赌徒把他揍得遍体鳞伤。

sentences.english: I paid for your bastard children. I've taken nothing for myself.
sentences.chinese: 我出钱养你们的小杂种，我自己什么也没有拿。

sentences.english: The villages in order to participate in the glorious pitch in their efforts did not dare enthusiastic.
sentences.chinese: 各自然村以参加为光荣，出钱出力莫不踊跃。

sentences.english: Although he has a lot of money, he didn't contribute to his colleague's wedding present.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他很有钱，但却没有出钱给同事买结婚礼物。

sentences.english: "I have to pay for almost everything she needs, such as medicine, myself," she said.
sentences.chinese: 几乎她所需要的一切，如医药费等，都是我自己出钱。

sentences.english: The school paid for an apartment and even lent me a Steinway.
sentences.chinese: 学院出钱为我租了公寓，甚至借给我一架施坦威钢琴。

sentences.english: It was rumored that it was a missionary of Catholicism who bribed people to poison the well water.
sentences.chinese: 有传言称是天主教的传教士出钱贿人往井水里投毒。

sentences.english: Dan Jiaxi already purchased cost of be transferred to civilian work presswork plant equipment gives money again feebly.
sentences.chinese: 但家喜已将转业费购置了印刷厂设备无力再出钱。

sentences.english: Of course, Democrats give money, too.
sentences.chinese: 当然，民主党人也会出钱。

sentences.english: Volunteers helping out fundraising for the earthquake victims.
sentences.chinese: 义工们为地震灾民筹款出钱出力。

sentences.english: Every year, his foundation pays school fees for less fortunate Kenyan children.
sentences.chinese: 拉加特基金会每年都要出钱，给肯尼亚的孩子交学费。

sentences.english: Government finance should be based on the principle of equitable distribution of the economic burden, which means that those who have money should contribute money.
sentences.chinese: 政府的财政应该放在合理负担即有钱出钱的原则上。

definition: to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
to dip into one's pocket/to pay out of pocket/to foot the bill
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
to be willing to sacrifice everything one has (idiom)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
